poem:
**Carinthian Morning**

Larch trees in the glass
of water—
still, like memory
reflected,

distance folds the hills,
a body's length suspended—
each stroke

unmade in the cool,
tranquil silence:
a moment held
between breaths,

beauty surfacing in the stop,
not the move.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Swanning around the Austrian lakes: a trip to Carinthia The lake was perfectly still, larch trees reflected in its glassy surface, hills folding into each other in the distance. I thought about swimming across it – a distance of about 1km – but once I was immersed in the cool, tranquil water, front-crawling through it with my head down lost its appeal. This was a moment to stop and take in the beauty of my surroundings.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Swanning around the Austrian lakes: a trip to Carinthia The lake was perfectly still, larch trees reflected in its glassy surface, hills folding into each other in the distance. I thought about swimming across it – a distance of about 1km – but once I was immersed in the cool, tranquil water, front-crawling through it with my head down lost its appeal. This was a moment to stop and take in the beauty of my surroundings.
